tweet: This is not a cage; this is a pervasive campaign of xenophobia disguised as national security manifested in physical form. If it were not chainlink, it would be something else. It's all real. It's all happening. It's all always been us.  https://t.co/F0JEBuqA17
Who among us hasn’t noticed a toddler wandering off from their mom in the supermarket and asked, “Are you lost? Do you need to me to send you to a chainlink pen in a government detention center?”

THREAD on Orwellian words used to sanitize incarcerating children:  cages = "chainlink partitians"  cells = "rooms"  jails = "youth development centers" or "juvie"  solitary confinement = "administrative segregation"  https://t.co/F68tDvV4y7

So nauseous at thought of children behind chainlink fences and lack of humanity.. but this vid explains effect on the kids brains and limiting their platform for success. Focus on 1st 1000 days but ++ windows in pediatric brains. #KeepFamilesTogether  https://t.co/INT7nnWtZS

My fall 2018 picture book called Little Brown is set in a chainlink fenced shelter.   It’s about dogs, grappling with existential issues. Dogs.   Who could have imagined that our country would have children in the same kind of place?

ICE: “We definitely aren’t keeping children in cages! They are basically like summer camp dorms...that you can’t leave...or call your parents...and are surrounded by chainlink fencing...and locked...and there are guards with guns...but they are definitely not locked in cages!”
@AceHardware Is Ace the Place for chainlink fencing used in “summer camps”? Deplorable.
